title: Quiz 1 - Percentage
instruction: Directions (46-50):  The following bar graph shows the percentage break-up of expenditure of India by department of economic affairs from year 2011 to 2015. With the given information, find the following questions.

quiz.text: If 35% of a number is 12 less than 50% of that number, then the number is:
options: 40
50
60
80
None of these

quiz.text: If 75% of a number is added to 75, then the result is the number itself. The number is:
options: 50
60
300
400
None of these

quiz.text: The sum of two numbers is 2490. If 6.5% of one number is equal to 8.5% of the other, then the numbers are:
options: 989, 1501
1011, 1479
1401, 1089
1411, 1079
None of these

quiz.text: An agent sells goods of value of Rs. 15000. The commission which he receives is 12 , is what amount ?
options: Rs. 1875
Rs. 2125
Rs. 2000
Rs. 2700
None of these

quiz.text: The monthly income of a person is Rs. 5000. If his income is increased by 30%, then what is his monthly income now?
options: Rs. 7000
Rs. 5500
Rs. 4500
Rs. 6500
None of the above

quiz.text: The price of a certain article is Rs. 15000. But due to slump in the market, its price decrease by 8%. Find the new price of the article?
options: Rs. 14000
Rs. 13800
Rs. 16500
Rs. 12600
None of these

quiz.text: A man losses 20% of his money. After spending 25% of the remainder, he has Rs. 480 left. What is the amount of money he originally had?
options: Rs. 600
Rs. 720
Rs. 750
Rs. 840
None of these

quiz.text: 15% of 10% of 20% of 1000 is?
options: 1.50
67
150
3
None of these

quiz.text: If the numerator of a fraction is increased by 120% and denominator is also increased by 350% then the fraction become  what was fraction ?
options: 4/5
5/6
6/5
5/4
None of these

quiz.text: If 40% of a number is equal to two-third of another number, what is the ratio of first number to the second number?
options: 2 : 5
3 : 7
5 : 3
7 : 3
None of these

quiz.text: A batsman scored 110 runs which included 3 boundaries and 8 sixes. What percent of his total score did he make by running between the wickets?
options: 45%
45
54
55%
None of these

quiz.text: If 50% of (x-y)=30% of (x+y), then what percent of x is y?
options: 20%
25%
30%
40%
None of these

quiz.text: In expressing a length 81.472 km as nearly as possible with three significant digits, find the percentage error?
options: 0.1%
0.034%
0.0020%
0.4%
None of these

quiz.text: Difference of two numbers is 1600. If 7.5% of one number is 12.5% of the other number, find the two numbers?
options: 2490, 4000
2400, 4150
2490, 4150
2500, 4200
None of these

quiz.text: Sixty-five percent of a number is 21 less than four-fifth of that number. What is the number?
options: 100
120
140
160
180

quiz.text: An inspector rejects 0.08% of the meters as defective. How many will he examine to reject 2?
options: 2000
2200
2500
2800
None of these

quiz.text: Which is greatest number?
options: 16
2/15
1/11
0.17

quiz.text: 16of 600 gm 33of 180 gm
options: 20 gm
30 gm
40 gm
60 gm
None of these

quiz.text: On a test consisting of 150 questions, Rita answered 40% of the first 75 questions correctly. What per cent of the other 75 questions does she need to answer correctly for her grade on the entire exam to be 60%?
options: 80
70
40
50
None of these

quiz.text: In an election between two candidates, one got 52% of the total valid votes. 25% of the total votes were invalid. The total number of votes were 8400. How many valid votes did the other person get?
options: 3276
3196
3024
Cannot be determined
None of these

quiz.text: In a college-election between two candidates, one candidate got 55% of the total valid votes 15% of the votes were invalid. If the total votes were 15,200, what is the number of valid votes the other candidates got?
options: 7106
6840
8360
5814
None of these

quiz.text: The population of a town was 48600. It increased by 25% in the first year and decreased by 8% in the second year. What will be the population of the town at the end of 2 years?
options: 65610
55580
60750
64850
None of these

quiz.text: In a mixture of milk and water the proportion of water by weight was 75%. If in the 60 gm mixture 15 gm water was added, what would be the percentage of water? (weight in gm)?
options: 75%
88%
90%
100%
None of these

quiz.text: Find a single equivalent increase, if a number is successively increased by 10%, 20% and 25%?
options: 55%
65%
75%
80%
None of these

quiz.text: The price of rice has been increased by 20%. How many per cent should Sanjay reduce the consumption of rice in the family so that the expenditure on rice remains the same as before in increase in the price of rice?
options: 15
16
20%
18%
None of these

quiz.text: An article is sold at a discount of 20% on the marked price. In order to gain 60% on marked price at how many more per cent of the discounted price it should be sold?
options: 75%
25%
65%
200%
None of these

quiz.text: In an examination, it is required to get 256 of the total maximum aggregate marks to pass. A student gets 192 marks and is declared failed. The difference of marks obtained by the student and that required to pass is 10%. What are the maximum aggregate marks a student can get?
options: 690
670
640
680
None of these

quiz.text: In an election between two candidates, 60% of the voters cast their vote out of which 4% of the votes were declared invalid. A candidate got 7344 votes which were 75% of the total valid votes. Find the total no. of votes enrolled in the election?
options: 1700
17659
17000
15000
None of these

quiz.text: Samar spends 52% of his monthly salary on household expenditure and 23% on miscellaneous expenditure. If he is left with Rs. 4500, what is his monthly salary?
options: Rs. 16000
Rs. 17500
Rs. 17000
Rs. 18500
None of these

quiz.text: In a class of 60 students, 40% can speak only Hindi, 25% can speak only English and rest of the students can speak both the languages. How many students can speak English?
options: 32
28
36
15
None of these

quiz.text: A, B and C invested in a business in the ratio of 3 : 2 : 5 respectively. If A earns 100% more profit than B and C earns 40% more profit than B, then what is the share of B in the profit?
options: Rs. 2420
Rs. 1560
Rs. 1135
Cannot be determined
None of these

quiz.text: Rajiv spends 20% of his salary on food, 15% on conveyance, 10% on education and 35% on house rent. If he spends Rs. 1950 on education, how much does he spend on conveyance?
options: Rs. 2925
Rs. 2242.50
Rs. 1300
Rs. 3000
None of these

quiz.text: In 2009, the food production was 5.5 million tonnes and in 2010, the production was 4.4 million tonnes. Find out the percentage decrease of produced food crops in these two years?
options: 18
20
16
22
None of these

quiz.text: After giving 25% discount on the entry ticket, the number of visitors increased by 30%. What will be its impact on the entry with respect to other days?
options: 2% decrease
2% increase
2% decrease
2% increase
None of these

quiz.text: A man spends 75% of his income. His income is increased by 20% and he increases his expenditure by 10%. His saving is increased by.
options: 10%
25%
27%
50%
None of these

quiz.text:
Quantity I Value of a number which is 25% more of a number which is 75 less than  225.

Quantity II Value of a number that is 87% less than a number that is 25% more than 1200.
options: Quantity I > Quantity II
Quantity I < Quantity II
Quantity I Quantity II
Quantity I = Quantity II
No relation

quiz.text:
Profit earned by an club is distributed among officers and clerks in the ratio of 7 : 4. If the number of officers is 35 and the number of clerks is 70 and the amount received by each officer is Rs. 28,000, what was the amount of profit received by each clerks?

Qunatity1: Profit (in Rs.) received by each clerk.

Qunatity2: 72
options: Qunatity1  Quantity2
Qunatity1  Quantity2
Qunatity1  Quantity2
Qunatity1  Quantity2
Qunatity1  Quantity 2 or No Relation

quiz.text:
In an examination the percentage of students qualified to the number of students appeared from school A is 80%. In school B the number of students appeared is 25% more than the students appeared from school A and the number of students qualified from school B is 40% more than the students qualified from school A.

Quantity1: Number of students qualified from school B.

Qunatity2: 160% of the number of students qualified from school A.
options: Qunatity1  Quantity2
Qunatity1  Quantity2
Qunatity1  Quantity2
Qunatity1  Quantity2
Qunatity1  Quantity2 or No Relation

quiz.text:
Qunatity1: x: If the perimeter of a circle is increased by 5% than x% will be the effect on its area?

Qunatity2: y: If the perimeter of a circle is increased by 10% than y% will be the effect on its area?
options: Qunatity1  Quantity2
Qunatity1  Quantity2
Qunatity1  Quantity2
Qunatity1  Quantity2
Qunatity1  Quantity2 or No Relation

quiz.text:
Qunatity1: x: Out of the three given numbers, the first number is twice the second and thrice the third. If the average of the three numbers is 154, difference between the first and the third number is x.    

Qunatity2 : y:
options: Qunatity1  Quantity2
Qunatity1  Quantity2
Qunatity1  Quantity2
Qunatity1  Quantity2
Qunatity1  Quantity2 or No Relation

quiz.text: In the IVth quarter number of local viewers are  more than the number of local viewers in IInd quarter then find the difference between the number of foreign viewers in Ist and IInd quarter together and number of local viewers in IVth quarter ?
options: 28 lakh
25 lakh
20 lakh
15 lakh
12 lakh

quiz.text: If the Foreign Viewers in 4th quarter is 10 lakh more than the foreign Viewers visited in 2nd quarter, then foreign Viewers in 4th quarter is what percent of total number of foreign Viewers in the whole year.
options: 33
32
31
25
35

quiz.text: If we include the 4th quarter of the year, percentage of Local Viewers in 3rd quarter will become 20% of the Local Viewers of the whole year, then what is the number of Local Viewers in 4th quarter?
options: 16 lakh
17.5 lakh
19 lakh
12.5 lakh
None of these

quiz.text: Total no of local Viewers in 2nd and 3rd quarter is what percent of total no. of the foreign Viewers in 2nd and 3rd quarter?
options: 53
57
59
51
49

quiz.text: Average number of local viewers from 1st and 2nd quarter is how much less than the number of foreign viewers from 1st quarter?
options: 0.25
22500
25000
35000
2500

quiz.text: If the total expenditure in year 2014 is 150 crore and expenditure on transport in year 2013 is 10% more than expenditure on financial services in year 2015 the find the total expenditure on Agriculture in year 2013 if there is a increase of  in total expenditure in 2015 as compare to 2014. (Rounded off to two decimal points)
options: 48.76
63.67
43.3
Cant be determined
None of these

quiz.text: Expenditure on financial services in year 2013 is what percent more/less than the expenditure on Agriculture in the same year ?
options: cant be determined
None of these

quiz.text: If the ratio of expenditure on financial services in the year 2012 and 2015 are in the ratio 7 : 5. Then what is the ratio of expenditure on Transport in the year 2012 and 2015.
options: 1123 : 271
1129 : 413
1133 : 353
1127 : 275
none of these

quiz.text: If the expenditure on financial services in 2012 is th of the expenditure on Agriculture in 2014. Then what is the approximately total expenditure on transport in 2012. (Given that total expenditure in 2014 is Rs. 300 crore)
options: 524 crore
512 crore
498 crore
508 crore
None of these

quiz.text: In every year there is an increase of 40% in total expenditure as compared to previous total expenditure then what is the ratio of total expenditure in 2015 to the expenditure on financial services in 2013?
options: 49:10
47:11
53:17
11:43
None of these
